name: Astor Place
description: Iconic NYC plaza with the Alamo cube sculpture. Smooth ground and skateable ledges.
history: A staple street spot for decades. The 2016 plaza renovation added smoother surfaces.
bestTimes: Late evenings and weekends. Can get busy with pedestrians during the day.
transitDirections: 6 to Astor Place, N/R to 8th St-NYU.

detailedNotes.terrain: Features include flat ground, ledges, marble benches, manual pads. Urban architecture repurposed for skating.
detailedNotes.culture: Part of the Manhattan skate scene in NoHo. A staple street spot for decades. The 2016 plaza renovation added smoother surfaces.
detailedNotes.tips: Best approach: 6 to Astor Place, N/R to 8th St-NYU.. Late evenings and weekends. Can get busy with pedestrians during the day.
detailedNotes.warnings: Public skatepark â€” standard park etiquette applies.
